articles.title: ‘Election matters’: Bangladesh vote reaches Britain, but some feel excluded
articles.description: For the first time, Bangladeshis abroad can vote. That's exciting many. But others can't vote — or won't.

articles.title: I Squared Said to Weigh Sale of $2 Billion Data Center Firm BDx
articles.description: I Squared Capital is considering options for its Asian data center business BDx, including a sale, people familiar with the matter said, signaling another potential deal in an industry riding the artificial intelligence boom.

articles.title: 2 people fined in killing of grizzly bear on Texada Island
articles.description: The bear, nicknamed Tex, had been living on Texada Island for more than a month when it was found dead last July in the Van Anda area.

articles.title: Senators player grades: Stutzle scores OT winner, Reimer near perfect in win over Flyers
articles.description: Tim Stutzle had a whale of a shift to close out the game in overtime, Nick Cousins found a scoring touch and James Reimer was near perfect for the Ottawa Senators in a 2-1 victory against the Philadelphia Flyers.

articles.title: Metro Vancouver delays vote to shrink off-leash trails in Pacific Spirit Park
articles.description: About one-third of the park’s users come with a dog, according to a Metro Vancouver report, and there have been some conflicts on the trails.

articles.title: Pedestrian struck by vehicle in North York
articles.description: Toronto police say a pedestrian was struck by vehicle in North York on Thursday night. It happened at around 9:35 p.m. in the Lawrence Avenue West and Brookview Drive area. articles.title: Copper Extends Retreat as Focus Turns Back to Soft Fundamentals
articles.description: Copper extended its retreat from a record high reached last week as the focus turned back to softening demand following a speculative buying frenzy that saw prices break free from fundamentals.

articles.title: Senators centre Tim Stutzle scores in OT to secure victory in Philadelphia
articles.description: With 74 seconds left in the third period, Jamie Drysdale of the Flyers broke Senators goaltender James Reimer's bid for a shutout -- but the Senators won in overtime.

articles.title: JSS: 2025 Sake Exports Grew Steadily, Reaching a Record 81 Markets
articles.description: TOKYO — Sake exports continued to expand in 2025 in both value and volume, with export destinations reaching a record 81 countries and regions. Export value increased 6% year on year to 45.9 billion yen, while export volume rose 8% to 33.55 million liters (3.73 million cases on a 9-liter basis

articles.title: Ingram leads Raptors past Bulls 123-107
articles.description: Brandon Ingram celebrated his one-year anniversary with the Toronto Raptors with a 33-point performance in a 123-107 win against the Chicago Bulls on Thursday.
